data:
1
00:04:10,000 --> 00:04:12,720
You are confused, aren't you?
Frightened.

2
00:04:12,760 --> 00:04:14,400
That's all right. I can help you.

3
00:04:14,440 --> 00:04:15,360
Who is this?

4
00:04:15,440 --> 00:04:17,360
I am a doctor.
Now, you must listen to me.

5
00:04:17,400 --> 00:04:19,960
You have lost your memory.
There was an experiment.

6
00:04:20,000 --> 00:04:21,800
Something went wrong.
Your memory was erased.

7
00:04:21,840 --> 00:04:22,800
Do you understand me?

8
00:04:22,840 --> 00:04:24,840
No, I don't understand.
What the hell is going on here?

9
00:04:24,880 --> 00:04:27,320
Just listen. There are people
coming for you even as we speak.

10
00:04:27,360 --> 00:04:30,160
You must not let them find you.
You must leave now.

11
00:04:30,920 --> 00:04:33,560
Hello? Are you there?

12
00:05:30,240 --> 00:05:32,600
Hey, Mr. Murdoch.
The Automat called.

13
00:05:32,640 --> 00:05:34,480
Said you left your wallet there.

14
00:05:35,400 --> 00:05:38,560
I suggest you retrieve it since
you only paid for 3 weeks...

15
00:05:38,600 --> 00:05:40,360
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

16
00:05:42,400 --> 00:05:43,920
I've been here 3 weeks?

17
00:05:43,960 --> 00:05:46,200
It's right there in
black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

18
00:05:46,880 --> 00:05:48,520
Day and date.

19
00:05:49,200 --> 00:05:52,520
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

20
00:05:52,560 --> 00:05:54,320
I'll take care of it when I get back.

21
00:05:54,360 --> 00:05:56,440
See that you do.
Only thing makes you a guest...

22
00:05:56,480 --> 00:05:58,720
in this joint, pal,
is cash on the barrelhead.

23
00:06:21,720 --> 00:06:24,160
House rules.
3 weeks is 3 weeks.

24
00:06:24,200 --> 00:06:26,840
No days off for good behavior.

25
00:06:47,920 --> 00:06:51,400
Mr. Murdoch, yes, where is he?

26
00:06:51,440 --> 00:06:55,000
He just left not 5 minutes ago.

27
00:06:57,920 --> 00:06:59,960
Sleep now.

28
00:07:02,000 --> 00:07:06,040
# When marimba rhythms
start to play #

29
00:07:06,080 --> 00:07:08,040
# Dance with me #

30
00:07:08,080 --> 00:07:10,960
# Make me sway #

31
00:07:11,000 --> 00:07:14,960
# Like a lazy ocean
hugs the shore #

32
00:07:15,000 --> 00:07:17,120
# Hold me close #

33
00:07:17,160 --> 00:07:19,800
# Sway me more #

34
00:07:19,840 --> 00:07:23,920
# Like a flower
bending in the breeze #

35
00:07:23,960 --> 00:07:26,280
# Bend with me #

36
00:07:26,280 --> 00:07:29,080
# Sway with ease #

37
00:07:29,120 --> 00:07:33,120
# When we dance
you have a way with me #

38
00:07:33,160 --> 00:07:35,240
# Stay with me #

39
00:07:35,280 --> 00:07:37,640
# Sway with me #

40
00:07:38,480 --> 00:07:39,440
Hey, sweetie!

41
00:07:40,360 --> 00:07:42,400
He said he was your
husband's doctor.

42
00:07:42,440 --> 00:07:43,840
He wanted to speak with you.

43
00:08:03,400 --> 00:08:04,320
Excuse me.

44
00:08:06,120 --> 00:08:07,240
Dr. Sh--

45
00:08:07,280 --> 00:08:10,200
Schreber. Please,
won't you come in?

46
00:08:10,240 --> 00:08:12,240
You must be Emma Murdoch.

47
00:08:13,120 --> 00:08:16,120
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

48
00:08:17,840 --> 00:08:19,520
What is this?

49
00:08:20,400 --> 00:08:24,280
A rather crude experiment...
designed to further my studies.

50
00:08:24,320 --> 00:08:25,440
I don't understand.

51
00:08:25,480 --> 00:08:30,360
You say you're my husband's doctor,
but he never mentioned you to me.

52
00:08:30,400 --> 00:08:31,680
The truth is, Mrs. Murdoch...

53
00:08:31,720 --> 00:08:34,080
John has been coming to
see me for quite some time.

54
00:08:34,120 --> 00:08:37,680
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

55
00:08:37,720 --> 00:08:40,720
stemming from your
marital difficulties.

56
00:08:40,760 --> 00:08:42,840
- John told you what happened?
- Yes.

57
00:08:43,880 --> 00:08:46,080
When was the last time
that you saw him?

58
00:08:46,120 --> 00:08:47,520
3 weeks ago.

59
00:08:47,560 --> 00:08:51,160
He packed a suitcase.
He was very angry at me.

60
00:08:51,200 --> 00:08:54,080
I understand how difficult
this must be for you.

61
00:08:54,120 --> 00:08:55,680
But for John's sake,
I would like you...

62
00:08:55,720 --> 00:08:58,240
to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

63
00:08:58,280 --> 00:09:01,880
It appears that John has suffered
a psychotic break.

64
00:09:01,920 --> 00:09:03,080
Complete memory loss.

65
00:09:04,680 --> 00:09:06,600
He may be delusional.

66
00:09:06,640 --> 00:09:08,480
Even violent.

67
00:09:08,520 --> 00:09:09,880
Emma...

68
00:09:11,120 --> 00:09:14,160
if he were to contact you,
and I suspect he will...

69
00:09:14,200 --> 00:09:16,960
you must call me immediately.
Do you understand?

70
00:09:17,000 --> 00:09:21,160
It is imperative that I be
the first one to reach him.

71
00:09:21,200 --> 00:09:24,400
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

72
00:09:26,240 --> 00:09:28,160
...for himself.

73
00:09:37,840 --> 00:09:39,640
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.

74
00:09:39,680 --> 00:09:42,320
It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

75
00:09:42,360 --> 00:09:46,080
Mr.--was it
"J"--something--Murdoch?

76
00:09:48,880 --> 00:09:50,040
J. Murdoch.

77
00:09:50,080 --> 00:09:53,440
What's your name? Justin? Jerry?

78
00:09:54,240 --> 00:09:55,400
No.

79
00:09:57,000 --> 00:09:59,000
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

80
00:09:59,040 --> 00:10:00,400
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?

81
00:10:00,440 --> 00:10:01,560
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

82
00:10:04,720 --> 00:10:05,680
Hi.

83
00:10:43,920 --> 00:10:45,200
Bumstead.

84
00:10:46,880 --> 00:10:49,920
I told the guy,
"Cash on the barrelhead."

85
00:10:49,960 --> 00:10:53,240
I said, "Listen, 3 weeks is 3 weeks."

86
00:10:53,320 --> 00:10:54,480
Where's our lucky winner?

87
00:10:54,520 --> 00:10:57,240
Upstairs, sir, room 614.

88
00:10:57,280 --> 00:10:59,920
Another call girl.

89
00:10:59,960 --> 00:11:02,400
"J. Murdoch."

90
00:11:03,520 --> 00:11:05,160
Evening, Husselbeck.

91
00:11:05,200 --> 00:11:06,480
Inspector Bumstead.

92
00:11:06,520 --> 00:11:08,360
Your lace is untied.

93
00:11:09,000 --> 00:11:10,560
Sir.

94
00:11:21,040 --> 00:11:22,480
Am I glad you're here, sir.

95
00:11:22,520 --> 00:11:25,040
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

96
00:11:25,080 --> 00:11:27,240
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

97
00:11:34,240 --> 00:11:37,960
Wow. Looks like somebody
woke up on the wrong side of the bed.

98
00:12:19,280 --> 00:12:21,720
- Hello.
- Oh, it's you.

99
00:12:21,760 --> 00:12:23,080
You left your wallet here, buddy.

100
00:12:23,120 --> 00:12:24,360
When did I do that?

101
00:12:24,400 --> 00:12:25,480
When you was last here.

102
00:12:25,520 --> 00:12:28,520
- When was that?
- When you left your wallet.

103
00:12:28,560 --> 00:12:30,240
You expect me to remember?

104
00:12:32,960 --> 00:12:36,040
Hello. Excuse me.

105
00:12:36,960 --> 00:12:38,840
No, no, seriously.

106
00:12:41,520 --> 00:12:42,920
Alleged?

107
00:12:56,560 --> 00:12:58,600
- Where you headed, chief?
- Home.

108
00:12:58,640 --> 00:12:59,640
And where's home?

109
00:12:59,680 --> 00:13:02,320
Haven't you mugs got
anything better to do?

110
00:13:02,360 --> 00:13:04,520
Well, I'm just trying
to do my job, May.

111
00:13:04,560 --> 00:13:06,560
There's a killer out there
in case you hadn't noticed.

112
00:13:06,600 --> 00:13:09,160
Maybe you should be out looking for him
instead of cooling your heels, huh?

113
00:13:12,400 --> 00:13:13,960
Go on, get out of here.

114
00:13:21,960 --> 00:13:22,920
Come on.

115
00:13:24,080 --> 00:13:26,240
Round and round she goes.

116
00:13:28,560 --> 00:13:32,480
Where she stops? Nobody knows.

117
00:13:35,560 --> 00:13:38,560
What's that make so far, Husselbeck?
6 hookers in all?

118
00:13:38,600 --> 00:13:40,000
I believe so, sir.

119
00:13:40,040 --> 00:13:42,440
Give the man an "A" for effort.

120
00:13:42,480 --> 00:13:44,640
You'd think these stiffs
would have the good grace...

121
00:13:44,680 --> 00:13:46,720
to expire at a good time of night.

122
00:13:47,680 --> 00:13:49,560
Hey, too bad about Walenski, huh?

123
00:13:53,080 --> 00:13:54,560
I guess he'd seen enough.

124
00:14:01,360 --> 00:14:02,320
So, Husselbeck...

125
00:14:03,720 --> 00:14:09,800
what kind of killer do you think
stops to save a dying fish?

126
00:14:09,840 --> 00:14:10,800
You've got me, sir.

127
00:14:10,840 --> 00:14:12,880
Bumstead, what took you?

128
00:14:12,920 --> 00:14:16,040
This killer's been running circles
around us thanks to Walenski.

129
00:14:16,080 --> 00:14:17,800
With all due respect,
Chief lnspector...

130
00:14:17,840 --> 00:14:20,680
I've known Eddie a long time.
He's a good cop.

131
00:14:20,720 --> 00:14:24,760
Whatever kind of cop Walenski once was,
he let drift a long time ago.

132
00:14:24,800 --> 00:14:26,560
Let me talk to Bumstead!

133
00:14:26,600 --> 00:14:27,880
Come on, let's go.

134
00:14:27,920 --> 00:14:29,240
Hold on!

135
00:14:29,280 --> 00:14:31,480
Frank, Frank!

136
00:14:32,880 --> 00:14:33,960
Get his arm!

137
00:14:34,000 --> 00:14:34,960
They're watching us!

138
00:14:35,000 --> 00:14:36,000
On your feet.

139
00:14:36,040 --> 00:14:37,400
There's no way out!

140
00:14:37,440 --> 00:14:38,720
Don't make us hurt you.

141
00:14:38,760 --> 00:14:40,400
God, can't you see?!

142
00:14:43,640 --> 00:14:44,920
Let me go, let me go!

143
00:14:44,960 --> 00:14:46,360
I'm not gonna hurt you. I'm not--

144
00:14:47,400 --> 00:14:49,520
- What was that?
- Walenski.

145
00:14:57,560 --> 00:15:00,600
I'm being punished for my sins, right?

146
00:15:00,640 --> 00:15:02,920
What did I ever do to inherit this?

147
00:15:02,920 --> 00:15:04,000
Where do you begin?

148
00:15:04,040 --> 00:15:08,800
Well, everything Detective Walenski
committed to paper should be here, so--

149
00:15:08,880 --> 00:15:12,200
The only thing that should
be committed is Walenski.

150
00:15:13,760 --> 00:15:16,000
Nothing like a little healthy paranoia.

151
00:15:19,400 --> 00:15:22,400
Sir, we just got
the fingerprint results in.

152
00:15:25,640 --> 00:15:27,320
What is this, some kind of joke?

153
00:15:31,400 --> 00:15:32,680
Don't throw anything away.

154
00:15:38,600 --> 00:15:39,640
Inspector Bumstead.

155
00:15:41,800 --> 00:15:44,440
I came here to file
a missing persons report for my husband.

156
00:15:45,200 --> 00:15:47,000
Take it to the front desk.

157
00:15:47,040 --> 00:15:48,800
They told me to come see you.

158
00:15:50,480 --> 00:15:52,600
His name's John Murdoch.

159
00:15:53,600 --> 00:15:56,480
Mrs. Murdoch,
why didn't you report this before?

160
00:15:56,520 --> 00:16:01,520
I mean, if your husband has been missing
as long as you say...

161
00:16:01,560 --> 00:16:04,160
I thought he'd simply
walked out on me.

162
00:16:05,280 --> 00:16:09,080
Then a...doctor contacted me
this evening.

163
00:16:09,120 --> 00:16:10,680
How long have you been married?

164
00:16:10,720 --> 00:16:11,960
Nearly four years.

165
00:16:13,040 --> 00:16:14,800
Why do you ask?

166
00:16:14,840 --> 00:16:17,800
Because you seem uncomfortable
with your ring.

167
00:16:17,840 --> 00:16:21,360
As if you were...
unaccustomed to wearing it.

168
00:16:21,400 --> 00:16:22,760
No, I never take it off.

169
00:16:29,080 --> 00:16:32,960
Do these names
mean anything to you?

170
00:16:38,080 --> 00:16:39,880
No. Who are these women?

171
00:16:40,760 --> 00:16:42,400
Why are you looking
for my husband?

172
00:16:43,080 --> 00:16:44,840
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

173
00:16:44,880 --> 00:16:47,080
Maybe. Maybe murder.

174
00:16:47,120 --> 00:16:48,120
Whose murder?

175
00:16:49,480 --> 00:16:53,000
- Which one?
- All of them.

176
00:16:53,960 --> 00:16:56,040
Mrs. Murdoch,
I am sorry, I'm sorry.

177
00:16:56,080 --> 00:16:57,120
I didn't mean to alarm you.

178
00:16:57,160 --> 00:16:59,600
I'm so sorry that I came.
Just both made a mistake.

179
00:16:59,640 --> 00:17:01,040
Mrs. Murdoch, if you please.

180
00:17:01,080 --> 00:17:03,440
If you'll just give me
half a second to explain--

181
00:17:06,600 --> 00:17:07,560
I'll be right out.

182
00:17:30,760 --> 00:17:32,960
Have we met before?

183
00:17:33,000 --> 00:17:36,480
If we did...
I hope you're still breathing.

184
00:17:36,520 --> 00:17:38,080
What's your name, honey?

185
00:17:39,680 --> 00:17:41,000
John.

186
00:17:41,680 --> 00:17:43,400
Well, that's an appropriate name.

187
00:17:44,240 --> 00:17:45,200
Yeah.

188
00:17:51,080 --> 00:17:52,240
I was just thinking.

189
00:17:56,280 --> 00:17:57,760
What you do...

190
00:17:58,960 --> 00:18:02,120
seems kind of dangerous...

191
00:18:02,160 --> 00:18:04,080
right now.

192
00:18:04,120 --> 00:18:05,760
I mean, how do you know
I'm not the killer?

193
00:18:05,800 --> 00:18:08,880
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

194
00:18:10,040 --> 00:18:12,480
You feeling any urges
I should know about?

195
00:18:33,120 --> 00:18:34,640
Aw, shoot.

196
00:19:30,920 --> 00:19:34,480
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

197
00:19:37,520 --> 00:19:38,520
Who are you?

198
00:19:38,560 --> 00:19:42,080
We might ask
the same question, yes?

199
00:19:42,120 --> 00:19:44,600
Sleep now.

200
00:20:10,280 --> 00:20:11,160
He can tune.

201
00:21:02,080 --> 00:21:05,240
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

202
00:21:05,280 --> 00:21:07,120
It is said he is able to tune.

203
00:21:07,160 --> 00:21:08,480
Impossible.

204
00:21:08,520 --> 00:21:11,200
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

205
00:21:11,240 --> 00:21:13,560
On occasion the imprinting
does not take.

206
00:21:13,600 --> 00:21:16,440
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

207
00:21:16,480 --> 00:21:19,960
We find them wandering
like lost children.

208
00:21:20,000 --> 00:21:22,080
But this one was different, yes?

209
00:21:22,120 --> 00:21:23,720
What has the doctor
to say about this?

210
00:21:23,760 --> 00:21:25,680
He has failed to report in.

211
00:21:25,720 --> 00:21:28,720
- And Mr. Quick?
- No more Mr. Quick.

212
00:21:28,760 --> 00:21:31,640
Mr. Quick, dead, yes.

213
00:21:34,560 --> 00:21:37,040
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

214
00:21:37,080 --> 00:21:39,840
Mr. Book, does he know?

215
00:21:41,120 --> 00:21:42,880
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

216
00:21:43,800 --> 00:21:46,560
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

217
00:21:46,600 --> 00:21:49,400
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

218
00:21:50,440 --> 00:21:52,880
Mr. Night, you will take the East.

219
00:21:52,920 --> 00:21:55,600
Mr. Face, you the West.

220
00:21:55,640 --> 00:21:57,640
Mr. Glove, the South.

221
00:21:57,680 --> 00:21:59,840
Mr. Shade, the North.

222
00:22:01,320 --> 00:22:04,160
We must have this man.

223
00:22:17,240 --> 00:22:22,040
Do you really think my husband could be
capable of committing those murders?

224
00:22:22,600 --> 00:22:24,520
Do you?

225
00:22:25,560 --> 00:22:28,880
Let's hope, for both our sakes,
that I'm wrong.

226
00:22:55,840 --> 00:22:57,040
John.

227
00:23:10,800 --> 00:23:12,840
I've been so worried about you.

228
00:23:16,120 --> 00:23:18,120
Are you punishing me?

229
00:23:18,160 --> 00:23:20,640
You know, if disappearing
is your way of punishing me...

230
00:23:20,680 --> 00:23:21,760
I don't appreciate it.

231
00:23:21,800 --> 00:23:23,760
I don't know what
you're talking about.

232
00:23:26,480 --> 00:23:28,880
I found these keys in my pocket...

233
00:23:28,920 --> 00:23:31,520
so I assume I live here.

234
00:23:31,560 --> 00:23:33,240
You supposed to be my wife?

235
00:23:33,280 --> 00:23:35,200
Supposed to be?

236
00:23:35,240 --> 00:23:37,200
John.

237
00:23:37,680 --> 00:23:39,360
You really...

238
00:23:39,400 --> 00:23:42,520
don't know who I am, do you?

239
00:23:42,560 --> 00:23:43,680
Your doctor called me.

240
00:23:43,720 --> 00:23:45,160
He was worried
that this might happen.

241
00:23:45,200 --> 00:23:46,640
My doctor?

242
00:23:46,680 --> 00:23:49,120
Yeah. He...

243
00:23:49,160 --> 00:23:51,080
he gave me his card.

244
00:23:51,120 --> 00:23:53,560
He's desperate to find you.

245
00:23:53,600 --> 00:23:56,000
Schreber.

246
00:24:00,160 --> 00:24:02,160
I feel like I'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

247
00:24:02,200 --> 00:24:04,840
What happened to me?
Why was I seeing a doctor?

248
00:24:05,560 --> 00:24:07,600
I had an affair.

249
00:24:08,640 --> 00:24:10,960
You were angry at me.

250
00:24:13,320 --> 00:24:15,080
The police are looking for you.

251
00:24:15,120 --> 00:24:17,320
I know. I saw the papers.

252
00:24:17,360 --> 00:24:19,840
"Killer stalks city streetwalkers."

253
00:24:23,200 --> 00:24:26,640
I was with one of those women...

254
00:24:26,680 --> 00:24:28,400
before I came here tonight.

255
00:24:29,040 --> 00:24:30,640
I don't understand.

256
00:24:30,680 --> 00:24:32,080
I met her outside an Automat.

257
00:24:33,520 --> 00:24:36,000
I guess I wanted to test myself.

258
00:24:36,040 --> 00:24:39,800
I wanted to know if I had it in me
to do those things.

259
00:24:39,840 --> 00:24:44,240
Maybe I have lost my mind, but whoever
I am, I'm still me and I'm not a killer.

260
00:24:50,320 --> 00:24:52,200
I believe you.

261
00:24:53,080 --> 00:24:55,160
You do?

262
00:24:58,240 --> 00:24:59,200
What?

263
00:24:59,240 --> 00:25:01,920
The car outside,
the one you arrived in.

264
00:25:01,960 --> 00:25:04,160
It's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

265
00:25:06,240 --> 00:25:08,760
I didn't know he was still here.

266
00:25:08,800 --> 00:25:09,760
John.

267
00:25:11,040 --> 00:25:13,640
Hold it right there, mister!

268
00:25:15,000 --> 00:25:16,880
Wait. You have the wrong man.

269
00:25:16,920 --> 00:25:18,000
Stand aside, will you, please?

270
00:25:18,040 --> 00:25:19,560
I didn't kill anyone.

271
00:25:19,600 --> 00:25:22,600
Right now what you are
is a suspect. Turn yourself in.

272
00:25:23,480 --> 00:25:24,960
I'll listen to whatever
you have to say.

273
00:25:25,000 --> 00:25:26,840
You're not gonna believe
what I have to say.

274
00:25:27,880 --> 00:25:28,960
Try me.

275
00:25:29,520 --> 00:25:31,040
There's someone after me.

276
00:25:31,080 --> 00:25:34,080
There's this group of men.
They want me dead.

277
00:25:34,120 --> 00:25:36,640
And I don't even know if--
They're not even--

278
00:25:37,360 --> 00:25:39,520
Yeah, who's gonna
listen to a madman?

279
00:25:39,560 --> 00:25:41,280
Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.

280
00:25:41,320 --> 00:25:42,400
Run!

281
00:25:46,080 --> 00:25:48,680
No one ever listens to me.

282
00:25:54,000 --> 00:25:55,080
Murdoch, stop!

283
00:25:59,960 --> 00:26:01,280
Murdoch!

284
00:26:36,000 --> 00:26:36,960
How much further?

285
00:26:37,000 --> 00:26:38,440
We're almost there, buddy.

286
00:26:41,040 --> 00:26:44,200
Hey, you happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

287
00:26:44,240 --> 00:26:47,040
You're kidding. Me and the missus
spent our honeymoon there.

288
00:26:47,080 --> 00:26:49,680
All you gotta do is take
Main Street west to--

289
00:26:52,400 --> 00:26:54,040
Or is it the cross--

290
00:26:54,080 --> 00:26:57,560
You know, that's funny.
I can't seem to remember...

291
00:26:57,600 --> 00:26:59,800
if it's Main Street west
or the cross-town.

292
00:27:04,280 --> 00:27:07,680
I'm sorry, lnspector,
I cannot be of more assistance...

293
00:27:07,720 --> 00:27:09,480
but I am running late
for an appointment.

294
00:27:09,520 --> 00:27:11,640
Well, I appreciate
your taking the time.

295
00:27:19,600 --> 00:27:21,800
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

296
00:27:21,840 --> 00:27:26,320
I've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

297
00:27:26,360 --> 00:27:28,920
Murdoch doesn't strike me as one.

298
00:27:28,960 --> 00:27:32,480
Perhaps you are not
accustomed to digging deep enough.

299
00:27:32,520 --> 00:27:34,920
Well, I do know when someone
is lying to me, Doctor.

300
00:27:34,960 --> 00:27:37,480
Forgive me, lnspector,
but you are not a clinician.

301
00:27:37,520 --> 00:27:41,120
Judging personalities
happens to be my business.

302
00:27:41,160 --> 00:27:43,080
Well, maybe you could
give me a few pointers.

303
00:27:43,120 --> 00:27:44,880
Certainly.

304
00:27:44,920 --> 00:27:46,840
Let's take you, for instance.

305
00:27:46,920 --> 00:27:50,120
You are a fastidious man, driven.

306
00:27:50,160 --> 00:27:52,160
Consumed by details.

307
00:27:52,880 --> 00:27:54,720
I would say your life is...

308
00:27:55,960 --> 00:27:56,920
rather lonely.

309
00:27:57,680 --> 00:28:00,160
Good evening, lnspector.
I really must be going.

310
00:28:39,840 --> 00:28:44,000
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

311
00:28:50,480 --> 00:28:51,440
Dr. Schreber.

312
00:28:53,160 --> 00:28:57,600
Most unfortunate it is that we were
forced to seek you out here.

313
00:28:58,480 --> 00:29:01,040
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this...

314
00:29:01,720 --> 00:29:02,920
moisture.

315
00:29:03,360 --> 00:29:06,400
- I'm sorry. I--
- Failed to report in, yes.

316
00:29:06,440 --> 00:29:08,960
I was frightened.
I have a weak heart, you know.

317
00:29:09,000 --> 00:29:12,680
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

318
00:29:12,720 --> 00:29:15,280
We found this
in his hotel room.

319
00:29:15,320 --> 00:29:19,080
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

320
00:29:19,120 --> 00:29:20,160
I tried to imprint him...

321
00:29:20,200 --> 00:29:22,240
but he woke up, he knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

322
00:29:22,280 --> 00:29:24,280
I tried to stop him but he was too fast.

323
00:29:24,320 --> 00:29:25,440
He has no memories, then?

324
00:29:25,480 --> 00:29:28,680
Only fragments.
The procedure, it was interrupted.

325
00:29:28,720 --> 00:29:32,360
I guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

326
00:29:32,400 --> 00:29:33,920
You have had strays
before, right?

327
00:29:33,960 --> 00:29:37,440
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can tune.

328
00:29:37,840 --> 00:29:40,520
But that's impossible.
I thought only you had that ability.

329
00:29:40,560 --> 00:29:44,680
You will process another template
of the subject's memories, yes?

330
00:29:44,720 --> 00:29:46,400
Of course. I'll imprint him again.

331
00:29:46,440 --> 00:29:50,720
No. We require them
for a quite different purpose.

332
00:29:51,560 --> 00:29:53,920
It's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

333
00:29:53,960 --> 00:29:56,280
We'll talk again
after tonight's tuning, but...

334
00:29:56,840 --> 00:29:58,560
no more delays, yes?

335
00:29:58,600 --> 00:30:03,200
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

336
00:30:10,400 --> 00:30:13,160
You appear quite frail, Doctor.

337
00:30:13,880 --> 00:30:17,240
Perhaps some exercise
would do you good.

338
00:30:30,320 --> 00:30:31,400
- Come in.
- Kate.

339
00:30:36,320 --> 00:30:37,920
- How is he?
- The same.

340
00:30:39,240 --> 00:30:41,720
Walenski? It's me, Frank.

341
00:30:47,800 --> 00:30:49,240
Come in, Frank.

342
00:30:52,000 --> 00:30:53,800
Close the door.

343
00:31:00,960 --> 00:31:04,200
I've been looking through
some of your old reports.

344
00:31:04,240 --> 00:31:06,160
It's an interesting case.

345
00:31:07,280 --> 00:31:11,920
The kind that can make
a man's career...

346
00:31:11,960 --> 00:31:13,120
or break it.

347
00:31:13,160 --> 00:31:15,400
Yeah, I was on that case.

348
00:31:15,440 --> 00:31:19,520
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

349
00:31:19,560 --> 00:31:21,320
Nothing happened, Frank.

350
00:31:21,320 --> 00:31:25,320
I've just been spending time
on the subway, riding in circles.

351
00:31:25,320 --> 00:31:27,160
Thinking in circles.

352
00:31:28,040 --> 00:31:29,080
There's no way out.

353
00:31:30,800 --> 00:31:32,600
I've been over every inch
of this city.

354
00:31:37,160 --> 00:31:39,400
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

355
00:31:39,440 --> 00:31:41,080
She's not my wife.

356
00:31:42,520 --> 00:31:45,360
I don't know who she is.
I don't know who any of us are.

357
00:31:45,400 --> 00:31:47,240
What makes you say that?

358
00:31:47,280 --> 00:31:49,280
Do you think about
the past much, Frank?

359
00:31:50,680 --> 00:31:52,080
As much as the next guy.

360
00:31:52,680 --> 00:31:55,680
See, I've been trying
to remember things--

361
00:31:55,720 --> 00:31:58,280
clearly remember things
from my past.

362
00:31:58,320 --> 00:32:03,560
But the more I try to think back,
the more it all starts to unravel.

363
00:32:03,560 --> 00:32:04,840
None of it seems real.

364
00:32:04,880 --> 00:32:08,120
It's like I've just been
dreaming this life...

365
00:32:08,160 --> 00:32:11,560
and when I finally wake up
I'll be somebody else.

366
00:32:11,600 --> 00:32:13,360
Somebody totally different.

367
00:32:17,920 --> 00:32:20,520
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie?

368
00:32:20,560 --> 00:32:23,400
Something to do with the case.

369
00:32:24,000 --> 00:32:27,320
There is no case.
There never was!

370
00:32:27,360 --> 00:32:31,600
It's all just a big joke!
It's a joke!

371
00:33:10,440 --> 00:33:13,080
Tonight's requirements are...

372
00:33:13,120 --> 00:33:17,680
12 family photo albums,
9 personal diaries...

373
00:33:17,720 --> 00:33:22,440
17 love letters,
assorted childhood photographs...

374
00:33:22,480 --> 00:33:26,400
26 wallets,
lD's and social security cards.

375
00:33:26,440 --> 00:33:28,440
These do bring back memories.

376
00:33:30,760 --> 00:33:32,880
This one is still warm.

377
00:33:32,920 --> 00:33:34,640
What is it?

378
00:33:34,680 --> 00:33:37,760
The recollections of a great lover?

379
00:33:37,800 --> 00:33:40,680
A catalog of conquests?

380
00:33:40,720 --> 00:33:42,160
We will soon find out.

381
00:33:43,480 --> 00:33:47,920
You wouldn't appreciate that,
would you, Mr. Whatever your name is?

382
00:33:47,960 --> 00:33:52,160
Not the sort of conquests
you would ever understand.

383
00:33:53,080 --> 00:33:54,080
Let's see.

384
00:33:55,320 --> 00:33:57,920
A touch of unhappy childhood.

385
00:34:03,520 --> 00:34:06,120
A dash of teenage rebellion.

386
00:34:07,800 --> 00:34:10,480
And last, but not least...

387
00:34:10,520 --> 00:34:12,680
a tragic death in the family.

388
00:34:12,720 --> 00:34:13,680
Doctor.

389
00:34:15,760 --> 00:34:16,800
Mr. Book.

390
00:34:23,960 --> 00:34:25,600
Why does Murdoch not sleep...

391
00:34:25,640 --> 00:34:27,480
during the tuning as the others do?

392
00:34:27,520 --> 00:34:31,480
I don't know. Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

393
00:34:31,520 --> 00:34:34,240
A freak of nature.
He's adapting to survive.

394
00:34:34,280 --> 00:34:37,560
What do you expect?
Weren't you looking for the human soul?

395
00:34:37,600 --> 00:34:40,040
That's the purpose
of your little zoo, isn't it?

396
00:34:40,080 --> 00:34:43,280
That's why you keep changing people
and things around every night.

397
00:34:43,320 --> 00:34:46,280
Maybe you have finally found
what you are looking for...

398
00:34:46,320 --> 00:34:47,480
and it's going
to bite you on your--

399
00:34:51,280 --> 00:34:54,760
It requires several of your lifetimes
to master our gifts.

400
00:34:54,800 --> 00:34:58,520
The idea that a simple man
could develop the ability to tune--

401
00:34:58,560 --> 00:35:00,000
Is absurd, I know...

402
00:35:00,040 --> 00:35:02,040
but what other
explanation is there?

403
00:35:06,640 --> 00:35:08,560
It is time.

404
00:35:51,880 --> 00:35:53,160
Shut it down.

405
00:36:08,200 --> 00:36:09,480
Get your paper right here!

406
00:36:20,560 --> 00:36:22,200
It's driving me crazy.

407
00:36:22,240 --> 00:36:23,600
I can't sleep.

408
00:36:23,640 --> 00:36:25,360
And they call my job "unskilled".

409
00:36:25,400 --> 00:36:26,640
You think you've got it tough?

410
00:36:26,680 --> 00:36:28,480
You try looking after these kids,
for a change.

411
00:36:29,320 --> 00:36:33,280
Anyways, Frederickson says
he'll take me off the damn night shift soon.

412
00:36:33,800 --> 00:36:35,640
Well, it's about time, dear.

413
00:37:48,320 --> 00:37:49,280
Hello?

414
00:37:52,000 --> 00:37:53,080
Hello?!

415
00:37:57,160 --> 00:37:58,480
Wake up!

416
00:37:58,560 --> 00:37:59,520
Hey!

417
00:38:01,800 --> 00:38:03,080
Wake up!

418
00:38:03,120 --> 00:38:04,960
Wake up!

419
00:38:06,560 --> 00:38:08,360
Wake up!

420
00:38:09,720 --> 00:38:11,360
Hello?!

421
00:38:12,720 --> 00:38:14,680
Can anybody hear me?!

422
00:38:17,640 --> 00:38:20,920
Let the tuning commence.

423
00:40:54,000 --> 00:40:56,920
The Goodwins.
Jeremy, Sylvia...

424
00:40:56,960 --> 00:40:59,160
Jane and little Matthew.

425
00:41:02,800 --> 00:41:04,800
Jane and little Matthew.

426
00:41:33,680 --> 00:41:36,240
The rich get richer.

427
00:41:36,280 --> 00:41:39,800
Probably have maid's quarters
before the night is through.

428
00:42:30,800 --> 00:42:32,520
Dr. Schreber, I presume.

429
00:42:33,040 --> 00:42:34,000
It's you.

430
00:42:34,040 --> 00:42:35,400
Hey, come on.

431
00:42:35,400 --> 00:42:37,520
That's no way to greet
a patient, Doctor.

432
00:42:37,560 --> 00:42:39,240
If that's what you are,
huh, Doctor?

433
00:42:39,280 --> 00:42:40,640
Mr. Murdoch, please, l--

434
00:42:40,680 --> 00:42:42,440
What is happening here?
Why is everyone asleep?

435
00:42:42,480 --> 00:42:44,760
Shh. Please keep your voice down.

436
00:42:44,800 --> 00:42:46,640
Why can't I remember anything?
What have you done to me?

437
00:42:46,680 --> 00:42:49,320
Nothing, nothing.
Please, I want to help you.

438
00:42:49,360 --> 00:42:50,600
We can't talk here.

439
00:42:50,640 --> 00:42:52,760
It is not safe.
If they see us together, they'll--

440
00:42:52,800 --> 00:42:54,160
I don't care.
I want some answers.

441
00:42:54,200 --> 00:42:55,480
I want some answers now!

442
00:42:55,520 --> 00:42:56,640
Who are they?

443
00:42:56,680 --> 00:42:58,520
Why are they trying to kill me?

444
00:42:58,560 --> 00:42:59,680
Answer me!

445
00:43:04,680 --> 00:43:07,720
My God. You really can do it.

446
00:43:07,760 --> 00:43:09,000
I did that?

447
00:43:09,040 --> 00:43:11,200
Listen to me, John.
You have their power.

448
00:43:11,240 --> 00:43:13,240
You can make things happen
by will alone.

449
00:43:13,280 --> 00:43:16,440
They call it tuning. That is how they make
the buildings change.

450
00:43:16,480 --> 00:43:18,920
Just now you acted out
of self-defense. A reflex.

451
00:43:18,960 --> 00:43:21,680
But I can teach you to control
your power consciously.

452
00:43:21,720 --> 00:43:23,960
Let me help you, John.
Together we can stop them.

453
00:43:24,000 --> 00:43:25,560
We can take the city back.

454
00:43:28,640 --> 00:43:29,400
My glasses.

455
00:43:31,760 --> 00:43:33,640
My glasses, please.

456
00:44:18,800 --> 00:44:21,360
He made a terrible
impression for the firm...

457
00:44:21,400 --> 00:44:23,640
Iollygagging around as he did.

458
00:44:23,680 --> 00:44:26,440
So I simply told Frederickson
I was going to have to let him go.

459
00:44:26,480 --> 00:44:29,080
And well you should have, darling.

460
00:44:29,400 --> 00:44:30,720
He attacked me.

461
00:44:31,640 --> 00:44:32,800
I don't know where he has gone.

462
00:44:33,880 --> 00:44:35,680
Come, Dr. Schreber.

463
00:44:36,680 --> 00:44:38,200
We have much to do.

464
00:44:38,240 --> 00:44:39,920
Yes?

465
00:44:40,440 --> 00:44:41,600
Yes.

466
00:44:55,960 --> 00:45:03,240
# They say that you're
a run-around lover #

467
00:45:03,280 --> 00:45:07,040
# Though you say #

468
00:45:07,080 --> 00:45:10,800
# It isn't so #

469
00:45:13,840 --> 00:45:19,360
# But if you put me down
for another #

470
00:45:21,640 --> 00:45:23,760
# I'll know #

471
00:45:23,800 --> 00:45:28,040
# Believe me, I'll know #

472
00:45:29,680 --> 00:45:33,400
# 'Cause the night #

473
00:45:33,440 --> 00:45:37,200
# Has a thousand eyes #

474
00:45:38,080 --> 00:45:41,840
# And a thousand eyes #

475
00:45:41,880 --> 00:45:45,000
# Can't tell, but see #

476
00:45:47,280 --> 00:45:53,600
# If you are true to me #

477
00:45:55,240 --> 00:45:59,120
# So remember #

478
00:45:59,160 --> 00:46:04,640
# When you tell those little white lies #

479
00:46:04,680 --> 00:46:14,680
# That the night
has a thousand eyes #

480
00:46:17,640 --> 00:46:21,800
# A thousand eyes #

481
00:46:28,200 --> 00:46:31,600
Tonight's experiment shall be conducted
in the following locations.

482
00:46:31,640 --> 00:46:35,880
The first subject
shall be imprinted here on Avenue M.

483
00:46:35,880 --> 00:46:38,320
Mr. Book. There is a problem.

484
00:46:38,360 --> 00:46:41,560
There is no Avenue M.
We were unable to complete it.

485
00:46:41,600 --> 00:46:45,160
During the last tuning
we detected a lack of control.

486
00:46:45,200 --> 00:46:47,760
An opposing influence
on the machines?

487
00:46:47,800 --> 00:46:52,320
Then this man Murdoch
is more powerful than we thought.

488
00:46:52,360 --> 00:46:54,080
He's becoming like us.

489
00:46:54,120 --> 00:46:58,480
So we must become like him.

490
00:46:58,520 --> 00:47:00,840
The good doctor
has done as we asked?

491
00:47:00,880 --> 00:47:04,000
The life and times
of John Murdoch, Volume 2.

492
00:47:06,320 --> 00:47:08,520
We must not do this.

493
00:47:08,560 --> 00:47:11,960
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

494
00:47:12,000 --> 00:47:14,560
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

495
00:47:14,600 --> 00:47:16,840
Everywhere he goes...

496
00:47:16,840 --> 00:47:19,360
everyone he seeks out
will be known to us.

497
00:47:19,440 --> 00:47:24,200
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

498
00:47:24,240 --> 00:47:26,800
Perhaps we have forgotten
what happened last time, when we t--

499
00:47:26,840 --> 00:47:29,840
Yes. Poor, poor Mr.--

500
00:47:29,880 --> 00:47:31,680
We have not forgotten.

501
00:47:31,720 --> 00:47:38,680
If Mr. Hand wishes to make this sacrifice
for the greater good...

502
00:47:39,240 --> 00:47:40,680
so be it.

503
00:47:40,680 --> 00:47:45,680
But to imprint one of us.
Failure has always resulted.

504
00:47:45,720 --> 00:47:49,120
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

505
00:47:49,160 --> 00:47:50,520
Imprint.

506
00:47:55,960 --> 00:47:57,640
This may sting a bit.

507
00:48:33,000 --> 00:48:34,800
Is it done?

508
00:48:35,520 --> 00:48:37,920
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

509
00:48:38,840 --> 00:48:42,240
I have John Murdoch...in mind.

510
00:48:46,800 --> 00:48:47,960
"Johnny...

511
00:48:48,680 --> 00:48:51,960
"l found this postcard
among your mother's things.

512
00:48:52,040 --> 00:48:54,080
"Brings back memories,
doesn't it?

513
00:48:54,120 --> 00:48:55,880
"Stop by sometime.

514
00:48:55,920 --> 00:48:57,640
"We'll see if we
can't hook ourselves...

515
00:48:57,680 --> 00:48:58,960
"another mermaid.

516
00:48:59,000 --> 00:49:00,880
"Love to Emma. Karl."

517
00:49:06,520 --> 00:49:08,000
Karl.

518
00:49:09,240 --> 00:49:10,880
Karl Harris.

519
00:49:18,880 --> 00:49:20,200
Harris.

520
00:49:20,640 --> 00:49:22,040
Harris.

521
00:49:24,200 --> 00:49:26,000
"Harris Karl."

522
00:49:27,880 --> 00:49:30,600
Excuse me. Can you tell
me the way to Avenue C?

523
00:49:30,640 --> 00:49:31,800
Try the subway.

524
00:49:35,640 --> 00:49:37,120
You got a problem, pal?

525
00:49:37,160 --> 00:49:40,000
You been working here long?

526
00:49:41,000 --> 00:49:44,160
25 years. No days off
for good behavior.

527
00:50:08,280 --> 00:50:11,320
We're looking for John Murdoch.

528
00:50:43,880 --> 00:50:45,920
She knows nothing, Mr. Hand.

529
00:50:45,920 --> 00:50:48,000
A dead end, yes, Mr. Wall.

530
00:50:48,040 --> 00:50:50,520
We thought his imprint would
allow us to track him, yes...

531
00:50:50,560 --> 00:50:52,880
but instead we have
been brought here.

532
00:50:52,920 --> 00:50:54,480
This is irrational.

533
00:50:54,520 --> 00:50:56,760
Instincts are irrational, Mr. Wall...

534
00:50:56,800 --> 00:51:00,080
and we must follow
where they lead, yes.

535
00:51:00,120 --> 00:51:04,440
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar...his job.

536
00:51:04,480 --> 00:51:06,440
He does not care about our job.

537
00:51:06,480 --> 00:51:09,200
Indulge us, Mr. Hand.

538
00:51:09,240 --> 00:51:10,800
If you were Murdoch--

539
00:51:10,840 --> 00:51:11,800
Yes.

540
00:51:11,840 --> 00:51:13,680
If...

541
00:51:13,720 --> 00:51:15,200
I were Murdoch...

542
00:51:16,800 --> 00:51:18,600
I would remember...

543
00:51:18,640 --> 00:51:22,080
how my wife had hurt me
by sleeping with another man.

544
00:51:23,560 --> 00:51:25,000
And then...

545
00:51:26,640 --> 00:51:30,000
I would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

546
00:51:33,520 --> 00:51:35,800
Leave me alone with her.

547
00:51:35,840 --> 00:51:37,520
There's work to be done.

548
00:51:40,880 --> 00:51:43,080
All change, platform 3.

549
00:51:43,120 --> 00:51:45,840
Platform 3, all change.

550
00:51:45,880 --> 00:51:47,520
All change? Excuse me.

551
00:51:47,560 --> 00:51:48,840
How do I get to the end of the line?

552
00:51:48,840 --> 00:51:50,360
You want the Express.

553
00:51:57,800 --> 00:52:00,920
No trains leave on platform 7.

554
00:52:00,960 --> 00:52:02,280
- You want platform 2.
- Got it. Thanks a lot.

555
00:52:02,320 --> 00:52:03,280
Hey!

556
00:52:03,320 --> 00:52:04,720
How come that train didn't stop?

557
00:52:04,760 --> 00:52:06,200
That's the Express.

558
00:52:07,480 --> 00:52:09,320
There's no way out, you know?

559
00:52:09,360 --> 00:52:12,160
You can't get out of the city.
Believe me, I've tried.

560
00:52:13,160 --> 00:52:14,760
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

561
00:52:15,240 --> 00:52:16,920
The one they've been looking for.

562
00:52:16,960 --> 00:52:18,720
- Who are you?
- Used to be a cop.

563
00:52:19,400 --> 00:52:21,760
At least, in this life, I was.

564
00:52:22,120 --> 00:52:24,160
They steal people's
memories, you know?

565
00:52:24,680 --> 00:52:26,400
Then they swap them around
between us.

566
00:52:26,440 --> 00:52:29,040
I've seen them do it.
Back and forth, back and forth...

567
00:52:29,080 --> 00:52:31,080
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

568
00:52:31,120 --> 00:52:32,320
How do you know all this?

569
00:52:32,360 --> 00:52:36,520
Once in a while, one of us wakes up
while they're changing things.

570
00:52:36,560 --> 00:52:38,720
It's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

571
00:52:38,760 --> 00:52:40,680
It happened to me.

572
00:52:40,720 --> 00:52:42,560
They'll come looking for you, Murdoch.

573
00:52:43,640 --> 00:52:45,200
Just like they'll come looking for me.

574
00:52:46,000 --> 00:52:47,240
But that's OK.

575
00:52:47,280 --> 00:52:48,680
I figured a way out.

576
00:52:59,640 --> 00:53:00,920
They were here.

577
00:53:02,720 --> 00:53:03,960
Last night.

578
00:53:04,000 --> 00:53:06,200
This was to be his home.

579
00:53:08,840 --> 00:53:10,600
That was when we loved her.

580
00:53:10,640 --> 00:53:12,440
This is all well and good, Mr. Hand...

581
00:53:12,480 --> 00:53:16,760
But we require a more practical link
to his present whereabouts.

582
00:53:19,360 --> 00:53:20,520
Yes.

583
00:53:21,760 --> 00:53:24,000
And I know where to find her.

584
00:53:31,520 --> 00:53:34,320
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

585
00:53:34,360 --> 00:53:35,320
I'm sorry?

586
00:53:35,360 --> 00:53:39,440
To be able to revisit those places
which have meant so very much to us.

587
00:53:40,200 --> 00:53:42,240
I thought it was more
that we were haunted by them.

588
00:53:42,240 --> 00:53:44,160
Perhaps.

589
00:53:45,720 --> 00:53:47,760
But imagine a life...

590
00:53:47,800 --> 00:53:50,320
alien to yours...

591
00:53:50,360 --> 00:53:52,000
in which your memories
were not your own...

592
00:53:52,040 --> 00:53:55,440
but those shared
by every other of your kind.

593
00:53:56,160 --> 00:54:00,280
Imagine the torment
of such an existence...

594
00:54:00,320 --> 00:54:02,680
no experiences to call your own.

595
00:54:05,200 --> 00:54:07,360
If it was all you knew...

596
00:54:07,400 --> 00:54:09,040
maybe it would be a comfort.

597
00:54:09,680 --> 00:54:12,280
But if you were to discover
something different...

598
00:54:13,480 --> 00:54:15,720
Something...better.

599
00:54:19,680 --> 00:54:22,200
There used to be a ferry
when I was a boy.

600
00:54:22,240 --> 00:54:23,920
Biggest thing you ever saw.

601
00:54:23,960 --> 00:54:26,960
Lit up like a floating birthday cake.

602
00:54:28,160 --> 00:54:30,320
That's just what my husband
once said to me...

603
00:54:30,360 --> 00:54:32,120
on this very spot.

604
00:54:33,400 --> 00:54:35,200
Where is your husband now?

605
00:54:35,240 --> 00:54:38,560
I wish I knew.
What brings you here?

606
00:54:39,360 --> 00:54:42,120
I met my wife at this place.

607
00:54:42,160 --> 00:54:43,880
It's where I first met my husband.

608
00:54:43,920 --> 00:54:46,080
Small world.

609
00:55:08,120 --> 00:55:09,280
No, no, no.

610
00:55:37,800 --> 00:55:39,160
Hello?

611
00:55:39,840 --> 00:55:40,960
Hello?

612
00:56:24,320 --> 00:56:25,600
What are you doing here?

613
00:56:25,640 --> 00:56:27,440
I've been following you.

614
00:56:31,160 --> 00:56:32,920
Hold it right there!

615
00:56:34,920 --> 00:56:36,240
Johnny?

616
00:56:36,680 --> 00:56:38,360
Johnny!

617
00:56:38,400 --> 00:56:39,600
It's been so damn long...

618
00:56:39,640 --> 00:56:42,360
I thought you'd forgotten
your Uncle Karl.

619
00:56:43,080 --> 00:56:44,840
You son of a gun!

620
00:56:47,760 --> 00:56:49,160
Uncle Karl?

621
00:56:52,520 --> 00:56:53,600
Wait.

622
00:56:55,680 --> 00:56:57,120
Is that me?

623
00:56:57,160 --> 00:56:58,320
Yeah.

624
00:57:07,000 --> 00:57:08,960
Shell Beach is where I grew up?

625
00:57:09,000 --> 00:57:10,080
That's what I said.

626
00:57:10,120 --> 00:57:12,400
Shell Beach, your hometown.

627
00:57:12,440 --> 00:57:15,520
I need to get there, Karl.
How do I get there?

628
00:57:15,560 --> 00:57:17,120
I don't know.

629
00:57:17,160 --> 00:57:20,080
- I haven't been there in years.
- Come on. You must remember.

630
00:57:20,120 --> 00:57:22,080
You gotta have some idea.

631
00:57:22,120 --> 00:57:22,960
Come on!

632
00:57:23,600 --> 00:57:24,800
Sorry, Johnny.

633
00:57:26,200 --> 00:57:29,000
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

634
00:57:32,400 --> 00:57:33,960
So bright there.

635
00:57:34,000 --> 00:57:36,160
Brighter times, I guess.

636
00:57:37,800 --> 00:57:40,120
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

637
00:57:40,640 --> 00:57:43,160
That's me and your pa.

638
00:57:43,200 --> 00:57:45,280
What a couple of handsome fools.

639
00:57:46,400 --> 00:57:47,520
What happened to my parents?

640
00:57:52,240 --> 00:57:53,400
Where are they now?

641
00:57:54,320 --> 00:57:56,240
They're dead, Johnny.

642
00:57:56,280 --> 00:57:58,600
They died when their house
burnt down.

643
00:57:58,640 --> 00:58:00,240
I looked after you.

644
00:58:01,160 --> 00:58:03,040
You don't remember that, really?

645
00:58:06,200 --> 00:58:07,520
What's that?

646
00:58:08,480 --> 00:58:09,840
What is that?

647
00:58:14,360 --> 00:58:16,000
It's a scar.

648
00:58:16,040 --> 00:58:18,520
You burnt your arm
pretty bad in the fire.

649
00:58:23,840 --> 00:58:27,000
- What does it mean, Johnny?
- It means these are all lies!

650
00:58:30,760 --> 00:58:32,640
Why are you here, Mrs. Murdoch?

651
00:58:41,400 --> 00:58:43,760
My husband told me
he'd been here.

652
00:58:47,440 --> 00:58:49,640
He told me he wanted
to test himself...

653
00:58:50,760 --> 00:58:53,040
see if he was...

654
00:58:53,080 --> 00:58:54,960
capable of--

655
00:59:03,800 --> 00:59:07,440
I wanted to talk to her. I thought maybe
she could help me find him.

656
00:59:08,600 --> 00:59:10,920
Stay here.
I'm gonna call the station.

657
00:59:21,800 --> 00:59:26,720
Yeah, this is Bumstead. Send the
homicide coroner to 1440--East, yeah.

658
00:59:27,080 --> 00:59:29,720
There's been another one.

659
00:59:29,760 --> 00:59:32,800
It's the same pattern.
I'll explain when you get here.

660
00:59:42,240 --> 00:59:44,320
Oh, God.

661
00:59:44,360 --> 00:59:46,480
It's OK. I won't hurt you.

662
00:59:46,880 --> 00:59:48,320
It's OK.

663
00:59:58,040 --> 00:59:59,920
Where the hell did she come from?

664
00:59:59,960 --> 01:00:01,400
I found her hiding.

665
01:00:02,120 --> 01:00:03,880
She saw what happened here.

666
01:00:29,840 --> 01:00:32,760
Are you ready to go home,
Mrs. Murdoch?

667
01:00:32,800 --> 01:00:35,360
The inspector is gonna take me. Thanks.

668
01:00:59,240 --> 01:01:00,440
It's beautiful.

669
01:01:02,880 --> 01:01:06,080
It was a gift from my mother.

670
01:01:06,120 --> 01:01:08,520
She died recently.

671
01:01:08,560 --> 01:01:10,760
I keep it with me
to remind me of her.

672
01:01:12,640 --> 01:01:13,920
I'm sorry.

673
01:01:17,240 --> 01:01:19,320
It's a funny thing, though.

674
01:01:19,360 --> 01:01:21,640
I can't remember
when she gave it to me.

675
01:01:24,080 --> 01:01:26,960
How do you think I could
forget a thing like that?

676
01:01:29,040 --> 01:01:33,040
Do you think about the past much,
Mrs. Murdoch?

677
01:01:35,120 --> 01:01:37,800
What's happening, lnspector?

678
01:01:37,800 --> 01:01:40,400
I'm not sure I know anymore.

679
01:01:43,800 --> 01:01:46,200
I left your old room like it was.

680
01:01:46,280 --> 01:01:48,320
You can sleep here tonight, huh?

681
01:01:48,360 --> 01:01:50,600
Glad to have you back, Johnny...

682
01:01:50,600 --> 01:01:52,240
even if it is for just a night.

683
01:01:52,280 --> 01:01:53,240
Karl.

684
01:01:54,320 --> 01:01:55,520
Is that the right time?

685
01:01:55,560 --> 01:01:59,280
Why, sure. That clock's
kept perfect time since I bought it.

686
01:01:59,320 --> 01:02:01,040
A.m. or p.m.?

687
01:02:02,120 --> 01:02:03,520
What do you think, Johnny?

688
01:02:03,560 --> 01:02:05,480
I don't understand.
How can it be night already?

689
01:02:05,520 --> 01:02:07,160
What happened to the day?
How'd I miss it?

690
01:02:07,200 --> 01:02:09,920
You're tired. Anything's possible.

691
01:02:09,960 --> 01:02:11,320
Look...

692
01:02:11,360 --> 01:02:14,760
get some sleep. We'll straighten
all this out tomorrow.

693
01:02:39,560 --> 01:02:42,360
"Guide to Shell Beach
by Johnny Murdoch. "

694
01:02:45,200 --> 01:02:46,960
Oh, come on.

695
01:03:04,760 --> 01:03:07,080
- Hello?
- Emma, he's here.

696
01:03:07,120 --> 01:03:09,160
He's acting mighty peculiar.

697
01:03:09,200 --> 01:03:11,200
I know. He's not himself.

698
01:03:11,200 --> 01:03:13,080
Keep him there,
and I'll be right over.

699
01:03:13,120 --> 01:03:15,360
- I'll try.
- Thanks, Karl. Bye.

700
01:03:17,760 --> 01:03:18,840
Johnny.

701
01:03:18,880 --> 01:03:20,640
I can't promise anything,
Mrs. Murdoch.

702
01:03:20,680 --> 01:03:22,200
We just have to play it as it comes.

703
01:03:22,240 --> 01:03:25,560
Johnny, we just wanted to help.

704
01:03:32,160 --> 01:03:34,000
Karl.

705
01:03:34,040 --> 01:03:35,360
Uncle Karl.

706
01:03:35,400 --> 01:03:38,960
Johnny, if you're in some kind of trouble...
well, maybe we could do something.

707
01:03:40,360 --> 01:03:42,760
Haven't seen you in so long.

708
01:03:43,080 --> 01:03:44,600
Yes.

709
01:04:54,240 --> 01:04:59,440
Mr. Murdoch...you've been
the cause of much distress.

710
01:05:03,320 --> 01:05:05,640
- Start talking.
- There's no need for this.

711
01:05:05,680 --> 01:05:07,000
There's no escape.

712
01:05:07,040 --> 01:05:08,960
The city's ours. We made it.

713
01:05:08,960 --> 01:05:10,400
What are you talking about?

714
01:05:10,440 --> 01:05:13,520
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories...

715
01:05:13,560 --> 01:05:17,240
different eras, different pasts
all rolled into one.

716
01:05:17,280 --> 01:05:19,680
Each night, we revise it, refine it...

717
01:05:19,720 --> 01:05:21,120
in order to learn.

718
01:05:21,160 --> 01:05:22,520
Learn what?

719
01:05:22,560 --> 01:05:23,960
About you, Mr. Murdoch...

720
01:05:24,000 --> 01:05:26,160
you and your fellow inhabitants...

721
01:05:26,200 --> 01:05:27,920
what makes you human.

722
01:05:28,440 --> 01:05:31,360
- Why?!
- We need to be like you.

723
01:05:32,280 --> 01:05:34,560
I understand you now, Mr. Murdoch.

724
01:05:34,600 --> 01:05:38,000
I remember that which you do not...
what you've been missing.

725
01:05:38,040 --> 01:05:39,640
The ocean, yes...

726
01:05:40,640 --> 01:05:43,160
running along the waves as a child...

727
01:05:43,200 --> 01:05:47,920
meeting Emma at the river...
That first kiss that followed.

728
01:05:48,520 --> 01:05:49,600
What are you?

729
01:05:49,640 --> 01:05:51,360
You've seen what we are.

730
01:05:51,360 --> 01:05:54,200
We use your dead as vessels.

731
01:07:58,600 --> 01:07:59,520
Get in!

732
01:08:14,400 --> 01:08:16,760
What about her? Ring any bells?

733
01:08:16,840 --> 01:08:18,120
She was alive when I left her.

734
01:08:18,120 --> 01:08:19,200
What about this?

735
01:08:19,240 --> 01:08:21,160
This is nothing. This is--

736
01:08:21,200 --> 01:08:23,400
It must mean something,
all those pictures.

737
01:08:23,440 --> 01:08:24,560
What pictures?

738
01:08:25,520 --> 01:08:26,520
I don't understand this.

739
01:08:26,560 --> 01:08:29,280
Stop playing games with me, Murdoch!
Stop telling me lies!

740
01:08:29,320 --> 01:08:30,720
I am not telling you lies!

741
01:08:30,760 --> 01:08:33,080
Help me out here.
Make me understand.

742
01:08:33,120 --> 01:08:35,120
I have this jigsaw puzzle
in front of my face...

743
01:08:35,160 --> 01:08:38,040
and every time I try to rearrange
the pieces, it still doesn't make any sense.

744
01:08:38,080 --> 01:08:39,400
You think it makes sense to me?

745
01:08:39,400 --> 01:08:41,400
I'm as much in the dark here
as you are.

746
01:08:41,440 --> 01:08:43,520
You let me ask you a question?

747
01:08:44,560 --> 01:08:45,920
You heard of a place
called Shell Beach?

748
01:08:45,960 --> 01:08:48,320
- Sure.
- You know how to get there?

749
01:08:48,360 --> 01:08:49,760
- Yeah.
- You tell me?

750
01:08:49,760 --> 01:08:53,760
All right. You just--
You go to the...

751
01:08:54,600 --> 01:08:55,640
Where? Where do you go?

752
01:08:55,680 --> 01:08:57,680
Just give me a second, will ya?

753
01:08:59,760 --> 01:09:01,360
You can't remember, can you?

754
01:09:03,560 --> 01:09:04,960
You think that's kind of odd?

755
01:09:06,880 --> 01:09:07,840
Wait.

756
01:09:07,880 --> 01:09:09,240
I got a better one for you.

757
01:09:09,280 --> 01:09:10,520
When was the last time...

758
01:09:10,560 --> 01:09:13,320
you remember doing
something during the day?

759
01:09:13,320 --> 01:09:14,360
What do you mean?

760
01:09:14,440 --> 01:09:16,600
I just mean...during the day.

761
01:09:17,480 --> 01:09:18,560
Daylight.

762
01:09:18,600 --> 01:09:20,120
When was the last time
you remember seeing it?

763
01:09:20,160 --> 01:09:23,760
And I'm not talking about some distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

764
01:09:23,800 --> 01:09:26,800
I mean like yesterday?
Last week? When?

765
01:09:26,840 --> 01:09:29,120
Can you come up
with a single memory?

766
01:09:30,600 --> 01:09:31,840
You can't, can you?

767
01:09:31,880 --> 01:09:35,000
You know something?
I don't think the sun even...

768
01:09:35,040 --> 01:09:37,600
exists...in this place.

769
01:09:37,640 --> 01:09:41,720
'Cause I've been up for hours and hours
and hours and the night never ends here.

770
01:09:42,480 --> 01:09:45,000
- That is crazy.
- You're damn right this is crazy.

771
01:09:45,040 --> 01:09:47,320
Listen to me, Bumstead.
It's not just me.

772
01:09:47,360 --> 01:09:49,280
It's all of us.

773
01:09:49,320 --> 01:09:50,840
They're doing something to all of us.

774
01:09:50,880 --> 01:09:53,520
- Shut up, I've heard enough.
- Please listen.

775
01:09:53,560 --> 01:09:55,200
- Shut up, will ya! Shut up!
- Listen to me.

776
01:10:05,040 --> 01:10:08,200
There has to be an explanation
for this somewhere.

777
01:10:16,000 --> 01:10:17,280
Explain this.

778
01:10:37,040 --> 01:10:39,160
John, I'm so sorry.

779
01:10:40,080 --> 01:10:41,840
I never meant to hurt you, John...

780
01:10:41,880 --> 01:10:42,960
and I did it,
and I don't know why I did.

781
01:10:43,000 --> 01:10:45,080
I wish I could take it all back.

782
01:10:45,120 --> 01:10:47,520
No. Emma... You didn't do it.

783
01:10:47,560 --> 01:10:50,240
This...affair of yours,
whatever it is...

784
01:10:50,280 --> 01:10:51,840
the thing you're
supposed to have done...

785
01:10:51,880 --> 01:10:53,640
you didn't do it.
I don't believe it ever happened.

786
01:10:53,680 --> 01:10:55,040
What do you mean?

787
01:10:55,040 --> 01:10:57,320
I know this is gonna sound crazy...

788
01:10:57,360 --> 01:11:00,160
but what if we never
knew each other before now?

789
01:11:00,200 --> 01:11:02,520
What if the first time we ever met...

790
01:11:02,560 --> 01:11:06,240
was last night in your--
in our apartment...

791
01:11:06,280 --> 01:11:09,080
and everything you remember...

792
01:11:09,120 --> 01:11:11,840
and everything that I'm supposed
to remember never really happened?

793
01:11:11,880 --> 01:11:14,360
Someone just wants us to think it did.

794
01:11:19,320 --> 01:11:21,600
You know, back in the apartment...

795
01:11:22,360 --> 01:11:24,680
I suddenly felt like
I didn't know you at all.

796
01:11:26,400 --> 01:11:28,800
It was as if you were a stranger.

797
01:11:31,000 --> 01:11:32,640
But how can that be true?

798
01:11:33,240 --> 01:11:37,200
I so vividly remember meeting you.

799
01:11:37,240 --> 01:11:40,160
I remember falling in love with you.

800
01:11:40,960 --> 01:11:42,680
I remember losing you.

801
01:11:43,040 --> 01:11:44,000
Time's up.

802
01:11:45,320 --> 01:11:46,720
No, wait, wait.

803
01:11:46,760 --> 01:11:48,800
Please, just...

804
01:11:48,840 --> 01:11:49,920
just one more minute.

805
01:11:56,160 --> 01:11:58,200
I love you, John.

806
01:12:00,920 --> 01:12:03,520
You can't fake something like that.

807
01:12:04,440 --> 01:12:05,720
No, you can't.

808
01:12:34,040 --> 01:12:36,480
Inspector? Sir?

809
01:12:37,840 --> 01:12:40,320
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

810
01:12:40,360 --> 01:12:43,960
I...kind of thought
you should know.

811
01:12:46,480 --> 01:12:49,040
Oh, and...
the chief wanted to see you.

812
01:12:50,160 --> 01:12:51,280
Sir...

813
01:12:57,120 --> 01:12:59,040
I knew you'd track the killer down, sir.

814
01:13:11,240 --> 01:13:12,160
Sir...

815
01:13:14,040 --> 01:13:15,040
shoelace.

816
01:13:27,720 --> 01:13:28,840
How can we help you, sir?

817
01:13:28,880 --> 01:13:31,160
You can sleep.

818
01:13:33,200 --> 01:13:34,160
Gentlemen--

819
01:13:34,200 --> 01:13:35,680
Sleep. Sleep.

820
01:13:39,200 --> 01:13:40,400
Evening, sir.

821
01:13:48,920 --> 01:13:49,920
Bumstead.

822
01:13:52,680 --> 01:13:56,120
I wanted to be the first
to congratulate you...about the case.

823
01:13:58,720 --> 01:14:01,400
Take us to Murdoch.

824
01:14:01,440 --> 01:14:02,480
Sleep.

825
01:14:28,960 --> 01:14:30,280
Dr. Schreber.

826
01:14:31,400 --> 01:14:33,120
I knew you'd come eventually.

827
01:14:33,160 --> 01:14:35,720
Don't you think it's about time
you started giving me some answers?

828
01:14:35,760 --> 01:14:37,880
Yes. Yes, of course.

829
01:14:37,920 --> 01:14:39,560
Won't you please sit down?

830
01:14:42,560 --> 01:14:44,480
I come here quite often.

831
01:14:44,520 --> 01:14:46,880
It's one of the few places
I'm allowed a moment's peace.

832
01:14:46,920 --> 01:14:50,160
You see,
they have an aversion to water.

833
01:14:51,280 --> 01:14:53,160
One could almost call it a phobia.

834
01:14:53,680 --> 01:14:56,800
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

835
01:14:56,840 --> 01:14:58,360
Right.

836
01:14:58,400 --> 01:15:00,360
Well, for now, let's just say...

837
01:15:00,400 --> 01:15:03,000
that you were the subject
of their experiment.

838
01:15:03,040 --> 01:15:04,360
We all are.

839
01:15:06,560 --> 01:15:08,400
You're not crazy, John.

840
01:15:09,160 --> 01:15:10,800
And you are not a murderer.

841
01:15:12,680 --> 01:15:14,360
I'm sorry about this. I truly am.

842
01:15:14,400 --> 01:15:15,840
But we do not have much time...

843
01:15:15,880 --> 01:15:18,400
and I cannot afford the luxury
of doing this the right way.

844
01:15:18,440 --> 01:15:19,920
Everything you need to know...

845
01:15:19,960 --> 01:15:22,200
all the answers
are in this syringe.

846
01:15:22,240 --> 01:15:23,360
I need you to inject yourself.

847
01:15:23,400 --> 01:15:25,720
It's the only way to
make you understand.

848
01:15:25,760 --> 01:15:27,000
You're kidding me, right?

849
01:15:27,040 --> 01:15:29,880
We're running out of time, John.
You have to do this now.

850
01:15:30,440 --> 01:15:31,840
Give me the gun, Doctor.

851
01:15:31,880 --> 01:15:34,240
Inspector, he is more
disturbed than we thought.

852
01:15:34,280 --> 01:15:36,880
I may not be the judge of personality
that you are, Doctor...

853
01:15:36,920 --> 01:15:39,760
but you're the one
who looks disturbed to me.

854
01:15:40,640 --> 01:15:42,360
You do not know
what you are doing.

855
01:15:43,520 --> 01:15:46,960
What, exactly is in this...Doctor?

856
01:15:48,640 --> 01:15:50,720
All the answers you've
been looking for, John.

857
01:15:50,760 --> 01:15:51,840
I swear to you.

858
01:15:53,320 --> 01:15:58,160
Guess I'll just have to
hold on to it for...safekeeping.

859
01:15:58,200 --> 01:15:59,360
If you don't mind.

860
01:15:59,400 --> 01:16:00,680
Let's go, Doctor.

861
01:16:01,960 --> 01:16:07,120
- Go? Where are we going?
- Shell Beach.

862
01:16:08,120 --> 01:16:10,400
That's where you want to go, isn't it?

863
01:16:10,440 --> 01:16:11,960
The ocean.

864
01:16:20,640 --> 01:16:22,080
Why are you doing this?

865
01:16:23,720 --> 01:16:25,280
What do you hope to gain by helping me?

866
01:16:25,320 --> 01:16:26,800
The truth.

867
01:16:27,520 --> 01:16:30,400
None of these maps extend far enough
to show the ocean.

868
01:16:30,440 --> 01:16:31,760
You won't find anything there...

869
01:16:31,800 --> 01:16:33,640
I promise you!
I've been there, and--

870
01:16:33,680 --> 01:16:36,120
If you've been there,
you can show us the way, then, can't you?

871
01:16:37,200 --> 01:16:38,720
We'll see for ourselves.

872
01:16:39,720 --> 01:16:40,720
I won't.

873
01:16:41,840 --> 01:16:44,480
I refuse.
You can't make me go there!

874
01:16:56,200 --> 01:16:58,280
You were saying, doctor?

875
01:17:09,560 --> 01:17:12,960
I don't understand.
Used to be a bridge here.

876
01:17:19,400 --> 01:17:20,920
Try that again,
your friends are gonna be...

877
01:17:21,000 --> 01:17:22,280
fishing you out of the canal.

878
01:17:22,280 --> 01:17:23,640
Just don't hurt me.
I'll tell you everything.

879
01:17:23,680 --> 01:17:25,600
It doesn't matter anymore anyway.

880
01:17:32,280 --> 01:17:33,400
What?

881
01:17:36,040 --> 01:17:38,240
Who are you people?

882
01:17:42,240 --> 01:17:46,560
We will give you some more
pretty things soon...Anna.

883
01:17:47,000 --> 01:17:48,160
I'm not Anna.

884
01:17:49,920 --> 01:17:51,760
You will be soon, yes.

885
01:17:55,680 --> 01:17:58,400
I have another use for her first.

886
01:18:04,880 --> 01:18:09,880
First there was darkness.
Then came the strangers.

887
01:18:11,960 --> 01:18:14,160
They abducted us
and brought us here.

888
01:18:15,400 --> 01:18:18,040
This city, everyone in it...

889
01:18:18,080 --> 01:18:19,400
is their experiment.

890
01:18:19,400 --> 01:18:22,200
They mix and match
our memories as they see fit...

891
01:18:22,240 --> 01:18:24,880
trying to divine
what makes us unique.

892
01:18:25,560 --> 01:18:28,200
One day, a man
might be an inspector.

893
01:18:28,240 --> 01:18:31,040
The next, someone entirely different.

894
01:18:31,080 --> 01:18:34,240
When they want to
study a murderer for instance...

895
01:18:34,280 --> 01:18:37,920
they simply imprint one of their citizens
with a new personality...

896
01:18:39,000 --> 01:18:42,840
arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

897
01:18:43,640 --> 01:18:44,640
even a lost wallet.

898
01:18:45,200 --> 01:18:46,800
Then they observe the results.

899
01:18:48,200 --> 01:18:52,120
Will a man, given the history
of a killer, continue in that vein?

900
01:18:52,160 --> 01:18:55,960
Or are we, in fact, more
than the mere sum of our memories?

901
01:18:56,040 --> 01:19:00,800
This business of you being a killer
was an unhappy coincidence.

902
01:19:00,840 --> 01:19:03,600
You have had dozens
of lives before now.

903
01:19:03,640 --> 01:19:06,840
You just happened to wake up
while I was imprinting you with this one.

904
01:19:07,560 --> 01:19:09,600
Why are they doing all of this?

905
01:19:09,640 --> 01:19:12,920
It is our capacity for individuality...

906
01:19:12,960 --> 01:19:15,400
our souls that makes
us different from them.

907
01:19:15,440 --> 01:19:17,720
They think they
can find the human soul...

908
01:19:17,760 --> 01:19:20,760
if they understand
how our memories work.

909
01:19:20,800 --> 01:19:22,000
All they have
are collective memories.

910
01:19:22,040 --> 01:19:24,760
They share one group mind.

911
01:19:24,800 --> 01:19:26,200
They're dying, you see?

912
01:19:26,240 --> 01:19:29,520
Their entire race
is on the brink of extinction.

913
01:19:29,560 --> 01:19:31,360
They think we can save them.

914
01:19:31,400 --> 01:19:33,720
- Where do I fit in?
- You are different, John.

915
01:19:34,320 --> 01:19:37,040
You resisted my attempt
to imprint you.

916
01:19:41,480 --> 01:19:44,760
Somehow you have developed
their ability to tune.

917
01:19:44,800 --> 01:19:46,040
That is how they change things.

918
01:19:46,080 --> 01:19:47,520
That is how they built this city.

919
01:19:47,560 --> 01:19:50,360
They have machines buried deep
beneath the surface...

920
01:19:50,400 --> 01:19:54,160
that allow them
to focus their telepathic energies.

921
01:19:55,000 --> 01:19:57,400
They control everything here,
even the sun.

922
01:19:57,440 --> 01:20:00,640
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

923
01:20:00,680 --> 01:20:01,880
So why do they need you?

924
01:20:01,920 --> 01:20:06,120
When they first brought us here,
they extracted what was in us.

925
01:20:06,160 --> 01:20:09,840
So they could store the information,
remix it like so much paint...

926
01:20:09,880 --> 01:20:12,280
and give us back new memories
of their choosing.

927
01:20:12,320 --> 01:20:15,800
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

928
01:20:17,600 --> 01:20:20,640
I understood the intricacies
of the human mind...

929
01:20:20,680 --> 01:20:23,080
better than they ever could...

930
01:20:23,120 --> 01:20:25,760
so they allowed me
to keep my skills as a scientist...

931
01:20:25,800 --> 01:20:27,160
because they needed them.

932
01:20:27,200 --> 01:20:29,560
But they made me
delete everything else.

933
01:20:37,600 --> 01:20:40,320
Can you imagine what
it is like being forced...

934
01:20:40,360 --> 01:20:42,000
to erase your own past?

935
01:20:42,040 --> 01:20:45,240
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

936
01:20:46,120 --> 01:20:48,680
Shell Beach, Uncle Karl.

937
01:20:49,440 --> 01:20:50,680
What about this?

938
01:20:51,560 --> 01:20:53,360
This was blank when I found it!

939
01:20:53,400 --> 01:20:55,360
You still don't understand, John.

940
01:20:55,360 --> 01:20:58,440
You were never a boy...
not in this place.

941
01:20:58,480 --> 01:21:01,160
Your entire history is an illusion,
a fabrication...

942
01:21:01,200 --> 01:21:03,000
as it is with all of us.

943
01:21:03,040 --> 01:21:05,440
You made those drawings
happen with your gift.

944
01:21:05,440 --> 01:21:07,240
You say they brought us here.

945
01:21:08,960 --> 01:21:10,080
From where?

946
01:21:13,760 --> 01:21:14,720
I'm sorry.

947
01:21:15,840 --> 01:21:17,520
I don't remember.

948
01:21:17,560 --> 01:21:19,200
None of us remember that...

949
01:21:19,880 --> 01:21:21,400
what we once were...

950
01:21:21,480 --> 01:21:23,800
what we might have been...

951
01:21:23,840 --> 01:21:25,120
somewhere else.

952
01:21:41,920 --> 01:21:43,800
I've taken you this far.

953
01:21:43,840 --> 01:21:45,880
You don't need me anymore.

954
01:21:45,920 --> 01:21:47,640
Let's go.

955
01:22:05,120 --> 01:22:06,840
John.

956
01:22:29,960 --> 01:22:32,640
There is no ocean, John.

957
01:22:32,680 --> 01:22:36,640
There is nothing beyond the city.

958
01:22:36,680 --> 01:22:39,840
The only place home exists...

959
01:22:41,640 --> 01:22:43,520
is in your head.

960
01:22:51,520 --> 01:22:53,200
No! No!

961
01:22:53,240 --> 01:22:55,000
John, stop!

962
01:22:57,480 --> 01:22:58,520
No!

963
01:23:01,120 --> 01:23:02,400
Stop!

964
01:23:07,840 --> 01:23:08,960
Please!

965
01:23:09,760 --> 01:23:10,920
No!

966
01:23:28,680 --> 01:23:30,720
And now you know the truth.

967
01:23:49,320 --> 01:23:50,520
No!

968
01:24:36,560 --> 01:24:39,360
You'll allow yourself
to surrender, Mr. Murdoch...

969
01:24:39,400 --> 01:24:41,520
or it will result in
this one's death, yes?

970
01:24:41,560 --> 01:24:43,960
What do I care?
She's not my real wife!

971
01:24:44,040 --> 01:24:45,080
She's nothing to me!

972
01:24:45,160 --> 01:24:49,200
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

973
01:24:49,240 --> 01:24:51,800
You see, I have
become the monster...

974
01:24:51,840 --> 01:24:53,720
you were intended to be.

975
01:24:55,480 --> 01:24:59,200
Shall I end her life now
as you would have?

976
01:25:02,120 --> 01:25:04,280
Don't hurt her, please!

977
01:25:04,320 --> 01:25:08,760
Then surrender, Mr. Murdoch.

978
01:25:08,800 --> 01:25:10,360
Sleep.

979
01:25:12,120 --> 01:25:14,240
Now.

980
01:25:16,000 --> 01:25:17,600
John?

981
01:25:32,000 --> 01:25:33,080
Sleep.

982
01:25:54,120 --> 01:25:56,800
The doctor was right.
He has evolved.

983
01:25:57,160 --> 01:25:58,640
Kill him.

984
01:25:58,680 --> 01:26:00,280
Kill him!
Kill him!

985
01:26:04,200 --> 01:26:06,840
Kill him! Kill him!

986
01:26:09,400 --> 01:26:11,800
He is powerful, yes.

987
01:26:11,880 --> 01:26:16,160
Dangerous. But he can also
lead us to what we seek.

988
01:26:16,160 --> 01:26:19,440
What the doctor calls the soul.

989
01:26:19,480 --> 01:26:23,040
It is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

990
01:26:23,080 --> 01:26:25,680
We no longer need
the other subjects.

991
01:26:25,720 --> 01:26:29,200
The time for study is over.

992
01:26:29,240 --> 01:26:33,280
It is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

993
01:26:39,680 --> 01:26:41,440
It is time, Doctor.

994
01:26:41,440 --> 01:26:42,960
Imprint.

995
01:26:45,640 --> 01:26:48,280
Shut it down!

996
01:26:48,320 --> 01:26:51,360
Shut it down forever!

997
01:27:04,640 --> 01:27:06,840
What are you doing?

998
01:27:06,880 --> 01:27:11,200
They want to imprint you
with their own collective memories.

999
01:27:12,520 --> 01:27:16,480
They want to make you one of them,
so they can share your soul.

1000
01:27:22,360 --> 01:27:24,600
Imprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

1001
01:27:24,640 --> 01:27:26,400
I'm sorry, John.

1002
01:27:26,400 --> 01:27:29,280
The pain will only last a moment.

1003
01:27:31,360 --> 01:27:32,280
No!

1004
01:27:40,360 --> 01:27:41,600
Remember, John.

1005
01:27:42,800 --> 01:27:44,680
You'll rise to greater
heights than that, my boy.

1006
01:27:44,720 --> 01:27:46,400
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

1007
01:27:48,120 --> 01:27:49,440
Remember.

1008
01:27:50,440 --> 01:27:53,200
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

1009
01:27:53,240 --> 01:27:56,320
Now remember what I told you.
Never talk to strangers.

1010
01:27:56,360 --> 01:27:58,080
John, remember.

1011
01:27:58,120 --> 01:28:00,840
You're probably wondering why I keep
appearing in your memories.

1012
01:28:00,880 --> 01:28:03,320
It is because I have
inserted myself in them.

1013
01:28:03,360 --> 01:28:05,360
All of these memories
have been fabricated...

1014
01:28:05,400 --> 01:28:07,040
to teach you about the strangers.

1015
01:28:07,080 --> 01:28:10,080
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

1016
01:28:12,800 --> 01:28:15,080
You will survive, John.

1017
01:28:15,080 --> 01:28:17,280
You will find strength
within yourself...

1018
01:28:17,320 --> 01:28:19,240
and you will prevail.

1019
01:28:19,240 --> 01:28:20,560
Remember.

1020
01:28:21,320 --> 01:28:22,240
Hi, Uncle Karl.

1021
01:28:22,280 --> 01:28:23,240
Johnny!

1022
01:28:26,120 --> 01:28:28,160
You're getting the hang of it, John.

1023
01:28:28,200 --> 01:28:30,160
Maybe one day
I'll be working for you.

1024
01:28:30,920 --> 01:28:34,040
This is the machine the strangers use
to amplify their thoughts.

1025
01:28:34,080 --> 01:28:35,880
The machine
that changes their world.

1026
01:28:35,880 --> 01:28:37,400
You must take control of it.

1027
01:28:37,440 --> 01:28:39,000
You must make the machine yours.

1028
01:28:39,040 --> 01:28:41,080
I know you can beat them, John.

1029
01:28:41,120 --> 01:28:43,480
But you must concentrate.

1030
01:28:45,640 --> 01:28:46,680
Something's wrong.

1031
01:28:54,960 --> 01:28:57,600
There is no time for romance, John.

1032
01:28:57,640 --> 01:28:59,840
The world can be what you make it.

1033
01:28:59,880 --> 01:29:01,840
What have you done?

1034
01:29:01,880 --> 01:29:04,280
You have the power
to make anything happen...

1035
01:29:04,360 --> 01:29:05,760
but you must act now!

1036
01:33:39,000 --> 01:33:40,400
I knew you could do it, John.

1037
01:33:40,440 --> 01:33:42,400
You have their power now.

1038
01:33:42,400 --> 01:33:44,200
You control their machines.

1039
01:33:44,240 --> 01:33:45,600
Where's Emma?

1040
01:33:46,280 --> 01:33:49,000
She is not Emma anymore, John.

1041
01:33:49,040 --> 01:33:50,400
She has been reimprinted.

1042
01:33:50,400 --> 01:33:52,040
So give her back her memories.

1043
01:33:52,080 --> 01:33:54,400
I can't. The facility
where the strangers...

1044
01:33:54,440 --> 01:33:57,320
stored the memories
has been destroyed.

1045
01:33:57,360 --> 01:33:59,440
I'm sorry.

1046
01:33:59,480 --> 01:34:02,080
What are you going to do now, John?

1047
01:34:03,720 --> 01:34:07,360
You told me I had
the power, didn't you?

1048
01:34:07,760 --> 01:34:10,160
I can make these machines
do anything I want.

1049
01:34:11,720 --> 01:34:13,960
Make this world anything
I want it to be.

1050
01:34:14,960 --> 01:34:17,880
Just so long as I concentrate
hard enough.

1051
01:35:39,240 --> 01:35:40,600
Where are you going?

1052
01:35:43,400 --> 01:35:44,840
Shell Beach.

1053
01:36:24,000 --> 01:36:25,360
- What's the fare?
- Quarter.

1054
01:36:31,360 --> 01:36:32,280
Oh, please.

1055
01:36:32,360 --> 01:36:34,760
- Oh, no--
- It's fine.

1056
01:36:34,800 --> 01:36:36,160
- Thank you.
- OK.

1057
01:37:14,720 --> 01:37:16,480
John...

1058
01:37:19,920 --> 01:37:21,960
Been waiting for you, yes?

1059
01:37:22,680 --> 01:37:23,800
What are you doing?

1060
01:37:23,840 --> 01:37:27,040
I'm just making a few little changes
around here, is all.

1061
01:37:27,080 --> 01:37:28,720
Are we sure that's what we want?

1062
01:37:29,200 --> 01:37:31,560
I'm prepared to take my chances.

1063
01:37:31,560 --> 01:37:33,080
I'm dying, John.

1064
01:37:33,120 --> 01:37:35,880
Your imprint is not
agreeable with my kind.

1065
01:37:37,320 --> 01:37:39,520
But I wanted to know
what it was like...

1066
01:37:40,800 --> 01:37:42,240
how you feel.

1067
01:37:42,240 --> 01:37:44,840
You know how I was
supposed to feel.

1068
01:37:44,880 --> 01:37:48,520
That person isn't me.
Never was.

1069
01:37:48,560 --> 01:37:52,160
You wanted to know what it was
about us that made us human.

1070
01:37:53,440 --> 01:37:56,680
Well, you're not going
to find it...in here.

1071
01:37:58,360 --> 01:38:00,840
You went looking
in the wrong place.

1072
01:39:35,240 --> 01:39:37,040
It's so beautiful here.

1073
01:39:42,160 --> 01:39:43,560
So bright.

1074
01:39:49,240 --> 01:39:51,960
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

1075
01:39:52,000 --> 01:39:54,520
I think that's it just over there.

1076
01:40:11,920 --> 01:40:13,920
I'm headed that way myself.

1077
01:40:15,760 --> 01:40:17,720
Would you like to join me?

1078
01:40:19,800 --> 01:40:20,760
Sure.

1079
01:40:26,240 --> 01:40:28,480
I'm Anna, by the way.

1080
01:40:28,480 --> 01:40:30,680
- What's your name?
- John.

1081
01:40:33,000 --> 01:40:34,400
John Murdoch.

1082
01:45:11,120 --> 01:45:14,880
# When marimba rhythms
start to play #

1083
01:45:14,920 --> 01:45:17,320
# Dance with me #

1084
01:45:17,360 --> 01:45:19,840
# Make me sway #

1085
01:45:19,880 --> 01:45:24,080
# Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore #

1086
01:45:24,120 --> 01:45:26,080
# Hold me close #

1087
01:45:26,120 --> 01:45:29,000
# Sway me more #

1088
01:45:29,040 --> 01:45:33,000
# Like a flower
bending in the breeze #

1089
01:45:33,040 --> 01:45:35,240
# Bend with me #

1090
01:45:35,280 --> 01:45:38,120
# Sway with ease #

1091
01:45:38,160 --> 01:45:42,280
# When we dance
you have a way with me #

1092
01:45:42,320 --> 01:45:44,240
# Stay with me #

1093
01:45:44,280 --> 01:45:47,040
# Sway with me #

1094
01:45:47,080 --> 01:45:51,640
# Other dancers may be on the floor #

1095
01:45:51,680 --> 01:45:56,160
# Dear, but my eyes will see only you #

1096
01:45:56,200 --> 01:46:00,720
# Only you have that
magic technique #

1097
01:46:00,760 --> 01:46:05,200
# When we sway I go weak #

1098
01:46:05,240 --> 01:46:09,040
# I can hear the sound of violins #

1099
01:46:09,080 --> 01:46:14,120
# Long before it begins #

1100
01:46:14,160 --> 01:46:18,120
# Make me thrill
as only you know how #

1101
01:46:18,160 --> 01:46:24,080
# Sway me smooth, sway me now #

1102
01:46:24,120 --> 01:46:28,960
# Sway me now #

1103
01:46:31,600 --> 01:46:34,840
# Sway me smooth #

1104
01:46:40,200 --> 01:46:45,920
# Sway me now #
